summary: I know you don’t like Dany or Jon and even though they’re my favs I’m curious about your opinion and I’m not coming here as hate...
question: I know you don’t like Dany or Jon and even though they’re my favs I’m curious about your opinion and I’m not coming here as hate or anything just curious. I know lots of Sansa stans want her to rule and Dany and Jon to leave let’s say this happened that she gets QITN and D&J leave it to her and they take the dragons and all of Danys army with them. Who defeats the NK and WW? That’s like the one thing I don’t get about people being mad about Jon bringing Dany to Winterfell.
answer:
Bran. 

Anyway no one is angry he brought her, they’re angry he knelt to her. He threw away the North’s independence to a character who just recently burnt an entire army alive and destroyed food because she was angry.

reblog.comment:
Bran. 

Anyway no one is angry he brought her, they’re angry he knelt to her. He threw away the North’s independence to a character who just recently burnt an entire army alive and destroyed food because she was angry.

trail.content:
Bran.

blog.name: madaboutasoiaf
blog.title: Fear cuts deeper than swords
blog.description: Jo, Female, Australian, This is an ASOIAF blog. Not a spoiler free zone

summary:
castleintheskye
 replied to your post  “I feel like writing an Arya ficlet or two to counteract the current...”
                ...
body:
castleintheskye replied to your post “I feel like writing an Arya ficlet or two to counteract the current…”

Snow + Winterfell (preferably childhood)

Arya loves snow. She runs through the godswood, breathing in the smells of snow and smoke and pine needles. The guests in Winterfell are complaining about the snow, about the cold.

“That’s stupid,” she tells Jon. “It is summer.”

Old Nan tells Arya she is a summer child, that the winter snows bring death but Old Nan also says that fear is for the winter, and Arya won’t fear snow until winter comes, and she’s not sure she’ll fear it even then.

Snow means snowballs. It means Sansa squealing and Bran laughing and Arya chasing her younger brothers, a melting snowball in her hand. Bran climbs a tree to get high, out of her reach but that doesn’t stop Arya. She just climbs up after him, the snow from the branches falling as she climbs, her discarded snowball melting, forgotten on the ground below her.

“The septa will see you,” Bran warns her.

“Not if I climb to the top,” Arya throws back at him.

Bran smiles when she joins him and it’s enough that she decides to just muss his hair with her wet hands.

“Stop it, Arya,” he whines, still smiling.

They sit together in the branches, watching Rickon looking up at them longingly, still too small to join them yet. The snow begins to fall once more, soft flakes that land on Arya’s cheeks, and melt in Bran’s fiery red hair.

Snow is Winterfell, she thinks. Snow is home.

castleintheskye replied to your post “I feel like writing an Arya ficlet or two to counteract the current…”

summary: What did you think about Bran in season 6?
question: What did you think about Bran in season 6?
answer:
Some bits were good! I liked what we saw of Bran’s boredom and frustration with the grind of learning magic stuff. I really liked when he asked if he could stay in the vision of Winterfell and watch the past version of his father for just a bit longer.

Structurally, however, Bran’s barely got his own plot. His season six material was thoroughly dominated by the setpiece of Hodor’s death (which I did not enjoy in the slightest) and the R+L=J material (which was extremely out of place, every bit as wheel-spinny as a lot of the rest of season six, misunderstood Ned to a significant degree, and didn’t even manage to clearly imply that no, no, R plus L equals J).

What I think about Bran in season six, basically, is that the story could have used more Bran.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Oh... I missed that part, my bad. But the reason i brought up Bran wasn't to say he was a traditional feminine sister,...
question: Oh... I missed that part, my bad. But the reason i brought up Bran wasn't to say he was a traditional feminine sister, obviously. It was more like when you said Bran didn't want to hang out with Sansa or Arya bc they're girls. Canon showed he like stories of the south just as much as Sansa, and he did play with Sansa and Arya too.
answer: Sansa definitely has a positive relationship with Bran. It is implied that they spend time to listen to stories together, and there’s even a scene where we get Bran recalling an advice that Sansa gave him. I would honestly love to see them think about each other more since Bran seems to be the sibling that Sansa is the most attached to. All of Sansa’s thoughts about Bran have been completely positive. Sansa dreamed of him smiling, she stated that she has used up all of her tears crying due to his fall (and Lady’s execution), she thinks of Bran when she sees Tommen, he’s one of the many people that she thinks of when she sings before the battle of the black water, she wants to name one of her sons after him, she describes him as being sweet and stated that everyone loved him, and she thinks of a time where she played in the snow with him and Arya. Clearly she loved him, and it’s clear that they’ve spent some time together. That being said, when Bran thinks of people to hang out with after his father and Robert left Winterfell to go hunt, he states not wanting to hang out with Rickon because he was a baby, and not wanting to hang out with Sansa and Arya because they were ‘’only girls’’. Also, he calls the stories that Sansa likes to hear ‘’stupid’’. I never said that they had a bad relationship, but that GRRM didn’t give Sansa a sibling that she has a tight-knit relationship with (at least not in the same wavelength as Jon’s relationship with Robb/Arya/Bran) nor did he give her a sibling that she could enjoy the more feminine-coded things she liked with. That being said, I do love this relationship and I am excited to see them interact with each other after they reunite.

reblog.comment: Sansa definitely has a positive relationship with Bran. It is implied that they spend time to listen to stories together, and there’s even a scene where we get Bran recalling an advice that Sansa gave him. I would honestly love to see them think about each other more since Bran seems to be the sibling that Sansa is the most attached to. All of Sansa’s thoughts about Bran have been completely positive. Sansa dreamed of him smiling, she stated that she has used up all of her tears crying due to his fall (and Lady’s execution), she thinks of Bran when she sees Tommen, he’s one of the many people that she thinks of when she sings before the battle of the black water, she wants to name one of her sons after him, she describes him as being sweet and stated that everyone loved him, and she thinks of a time where she played in the snow with him and Arya. Clearly she loved him, and it’s clear that they’ve spent some time together. That being said, when Bran thinks of people to hang out with after his father and Robert left Winterfell to go hunt, he states not wanting to hang out with Rickon because he was a baby, and not wanting to hang out with Sansa and Arya because they were ‘’only girls’’. Also, he calls the stories that Sansa likes to hear ‘’stupid’’. I never said that they had a bad relationship, but that GRRM didn’t give Sansa a sibling that she has a tight-knit relationship with (at least not in the same wavelength as Jon’s relationship with Robb/Arya/Bran) nor did he give her a sibling that she could enjoy the more feminine-coded things she liked with. That being said, I do love this relationship and I am excited to see them interact with each other after they reunite.

trail.content_raw: Sansa definitely has a positive relationship with Bran. It is implied that they spend time to listen to stories together, and there’s even a scene where we get Bran recalling an advice that Sansa gave him. I would honestly love to see them think about each other more since Bran seems to be the sibling that Sansa is the most attached to. All of Sansa’s thoughts about Bran have been completely positive. Sansa dreamed of him smiling, she stated that she has used up all of her tears crying due to his fall (and Lady’s execution), she thinks of Bran when she sees Tommen, he’s one of the many people that she thinks of when she sings before the battle of the black water, she wants to name one of her sons after him, she describes him as being sweet and stated that everyone loved him, and she thinks of a time where she played in the snow with him and Arya. Clearly she loved him, and it’s clear that they’ve spent some time together. That being said, when Bran thinks of people to hang out with after his father and Robert left Winterfell to go hunt, he states not wanting to hang out with Rickon because he was a baby, and not wanting to hang out with Sansa and Arya because they were ‘’only girls’’. Also, he calls the stories that Sansa likes to hear ‘’stupid’’. I never said that they had a bad relationship, but that GRRM didn’t give Sansa a sibling that she has a tight-knit relationship with (at least not in the same wavelength as Jon’s relationship with Robb/Arya/Bran) nor did he give her a sibling that she could enjoy the more feminine-coded things she liked with. That being said, I do love this relationship and I am excited to see them interact with each other after they reunite.
